solution_line_template: Joey Chestnut ate {joey_chestnut_record} hotdogs to claim the record and Lisa has eaten {lisa_eaten_hotdogs} hot dogs so far, so she still needs to eat {joey_chestnut_record}-{lisa_eaten_hotdogs}=<<{joey_chestnut_record}-{lisa_eaten_hotdogs}={hotdogs_needed}>>{hotdogs_needed} hotdogs to tie Joey Chestnut.

Lisa has a {total_time_minutes} minute time period to eat the hotdogs and half the time has already passed, which means Lisa has {total_time_minutes}/{time_divisor}=<<{total_time_minutes}/{time_divisor}={minutes_left}>>{minutes_left} minutes left until the competition is over.

If she needs to eat {hotdogs_needed} hotdogs to tie Joey Chestnut and there are {minutes_left} minutes left in the competition period then she needs to eat {hotdogs_needed}/{minutes_left}=<<{hotdogs_needed}/{minutes_left}={hotdogs_per_minute}>>{hotdogs_per_minute} hot dogs per minute to have a chance of tying for a win.
